**Goal**: Build your skills as ai engineering

**Weekly Plan**:
- Week 1-2: Core concepts
- Week 3-4: Hands-on practice

**Actions**:
1. Set up development environment
2. Follow structured learning path
3. Build small projects
4. Document your progress

10c68d7c-87b6-466a-833c-8cc04a276fef.summary: This 2-month roadmap is designed to elevate a Junior Python Developer in Nairobi to a mid-level Software Engineer. It focuses on mastering the 'Silicon Savannah' tech stack: Advanced Python, FastAPI/Django, PostgreSQL, and basic DevOps, with a specific focus on Fintech and SaaS integration common in the Kenyan market.

months.title: Month 1: Advanced Backend & Scalable Architecture
tasks: Master Python Type Hinting and Pydantic models
Optimize SQL queries and understand indexing
Build a RESTful API with documentation using Swagger/OpenAPI
projects: E-commerce Backend with M-Pesa Integration: A robust API that handles product catalogs, secure checkout, and real-time payment callbacks using Daraja.
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: Deep Dive into Python & FastAPI
Focus on `asyncio`, decorators, and context managers. Transition from Flask/Django to FastAPI for performance. 

### Week 2: Database Mastery
Learn PostgreSQL specifically. Understand relational mapping (SQLAlchemy), migrations (Alembic), and how to write raw SQL for performance-critical tasks.

### Week 3: Integration & Payments
In Nairobi, Fintech is king. Study the Safaricom Daraja API documentation. Implement C2B and B2C flows.

### Week 4: System Design & Testing
Learn about Load Balancers, Caching (Redis), and write unit tests using `pytest`. Aim for >80% coverage.

resources.name: FastAPI Official Documentation
resources.description: The best resource for learning modern Python web development.

resources.name: Safaricom Daraja Portal
resources.description: Essential for any developer in Kenya to understand mobile money integration.

resources.name: Python Nairobi Community
resources.description: Local user group for networking and technical talks.

months.title: Month 2: Frontend, DevOps & Career Positioning
tasks: Containerize a Python application using Docker
Set up a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing and deployment
Build a basic React dashboard to consume your Month 1 API
Optimize LinkedIn profile for the Nairobi tech market
projects: Full-Stack Inventory Management System: A containerized application with a React frontend, Python backend, and automated deployment to a cloud provider.
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 5: React for Backend Developers
Don't aim for UI/UX mastery; focus on state management (Hooks) and fetching data from your Python APIs.

### Week 6: Docker & DevOps
Learn to write Dockerfiles and use Docker Compose. Understand the 'Twelve-Factor App' methodology.

### Week 7: Deployment & Cloud
Deploy your project to a VPS like DigitalOcean or AWS. Set up a custom domain and SSL (Let's Encrypt).

### Week 8: Networking & Soft Skills
Update your CV to highlight 'Software Engineer' rather than 'Junior'. Practice LeetCode (Easy/Medium) and reach out to recruiters at local firms like Safaricom, Equity, and local startups.

resources.name: Full Stack Open
resources.description: Comprehensive guide to React and modern web development.

resources.name: iHub Nairobi
resources.description: The heart of the Nairobi tech scene for co-working and networking events.

10c68d7c-87b6-466a-833c-8cc04a276fef.additional_info: In Nairobi, networking is as important as coding. Attend 'Nairobi Tech Week' or meetups at iHub and Gearbox. When applying, emphasize your ability to integrate local payment solutions and your understanding of cloud deployment, as these are highly sought-after skills in the local SaaS and Fintech sectors.

f75f98de-ea39-4a77-859b-357c1f220f26.summary: This 6-month roadmap transforms a Python beginner into a job-ready AI Engineer specifically tailored for the Kenyan tech ecosystem. It balances mathematical foundations, core machine learning, deep learning, and MLOps, with a heavy focus on local industry needs like Fintech and Agriculture.

months.title: Mathematics & Data Foundations
projects: Nairobi Real Estate EDA: Analyze and visualize price trends in different Nairobi suburbs using scraped data.
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: Linear Algebra & Calculus
Focus on matrices, eigenvalues, and gradients which are the backbone of backpropagation.
### Week 2: Statistics & Probability
Learn about mean, median, standard deviation, and Bayesian probability.
### Week 3: NumPy & Pandas
Master data manipulation. Practice joining, merging, and pivoting datasets.
### Week 4: Data Visualization
Use Matplotlib and Seaborn to tell stories with data.

resources.name: Khan Academy: Multivariable Calculus
resources.description: Essential math for understanding how models learn.

resources.name: AI Kenya Community
resources.description: The primary hub for AI enthusiasts in Kenya. Join their Slack/Discord.

months.title: Classical Machine Learning
tasks: Build Decision Trees and Random Forests
projects: M-Pesa Churn Predictor: Build a model to predict which customers might stop using a mobile money service based on transaction patterns.
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: Supervised Learning (Regression)
Focus on predicting continuous values.
### Week 2: Supervised Learning (Classification)
Focus on binary and multi-class classification.
### Week 3: Unsupervised Learning
Learn clustering and dimensionality reduction (PCA).
### Week 4: Model Tuning
Learn Hyperparameter optimization using GridSearch and Cross-Validation.

resources.name: Zindi Africa
resources.description: The largest African data science competition platform. Great for local datasets.

resources.name: Scikit-Learn Documentation
resources.description: Industry standard library for classical ML.

months.title: Deep Learning Fundamentals
tasks: Build a multi-layer perceptron from scratch
projects: Maize Disease Classifier: Create a CNN that identifies diseases in maize leaves from images, a high-value use case for Kenyan agritech.
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: Introduction to PyTorch
Tensors, Autograd, and the PyTorch ecosystem.
### Week 2: Building Neural Networks
Designing architectures and loss functions.
### Week 3: Computer Vision
Implementing CNNs for image classification.
### Week 4: Transfer Learning
Using pre-trained models like ResNet to solve local problems with small datasets.

resources.name: DeepLearning.AI (Andrew Ng)
resources.description: The gold standard for learning Deep Learning theory.

resources.name: Data Science East Africa
resources.description: Meetup group for networking with local practitioners.

months.title: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
tasks: Perform Sentiment Analysis on local tweets
projects: Sheng/Swahili Customer Support Bot: A chatbot that understands local dialects to assist users with common queries.
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: Text Preprocessing
Stemming, Lemmatization, and Word Embeddings (Word2Vec).
### Week 2: Attention Mechanism & Transformers
Understand why 'Attention is All You Need'.
### Week 3: HuggingFace Ecosystem
Using the Transformers library for summarization and translation.
### Week 4: Large Language Models (LLMs)
Prompt engineering and building apps with the OpenAI API or Llama 3.

resources.name: Hugging Face Course
resources.description: The best resource for modern NLP.

resources.name: Lanfrica
resources.description: A hub for African language resources and datasets.

months.title: AI Engineering & MLOps
tasks: Containerize an ML model with Docker
Build a REST API for model inference
projects: Production-Ready Credit Scoring API: Deploy your Month 2 project as a scalable API with documentation and monitoring.
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: API Development
Building robust endpoints with FastAPI.
### Week 2: Dockerization
Packaging your environment to ensure it runs anywhere.
### Week 3: Cloud Basics
Deploying a container to AWS Lambda or Azure App Service.
### Week 4: MLOps Tools
Introduction to tracking experiments with MLflow or Weights & Biases.

resources.name: Made With ML
resources.description: Excellent guide on the full ML lifecycle from code to production.

months.title: Portfolio & Job Market Integration
tasks: Write 2 technical blog posts on Medium/Dev.to
Optimize LinkedIn profile for Kenyan recruiters
projects: End-to-End AI Portfolio: A centralized repository showcasing all previous projects with clear READMEs and live demos.
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: Portfolio Polish
Clean up GitHub repos and write comprehensive documentation.
### Week 2: Networking
Attend a physical tech meetup in Nairobi (e.g., iHub, Gearbox).
### Week 3: Interview Prep
Practice ML system design and coding challenges.
### Week 4: Job Applications
Target companies like Safaricom, Equity Bank, and local AI startups (e.g., Protica, Apollo Agriculture).

resources.name: iHub Nairobi
resources.description: Innovation hub for networking and finding job leads in Kenya.

f75f98de-ea39-4a77-859b-357c1f220f26.additional_info: In Kenya, AI Engineers are often expected to be 'Full Stack'. Focus on being able to deploy your models, not just train them. The fintech sector is the largest employer of AI talent locally, so understanding financial data is a major plus. Always participate in Zindi hackathons to build a reputation in the African data science scene.

359d388d-68af-49b6-ab05-d55d91d31827.summary: A 90-day intensive roadmap designed to transition a Junior Python developer into a market-ready Full-Stack Software Engineer in Kenya. This plan focuses on the Django/React stack, which is highly sought after by Kenyan fintechs, startups, and established firms like Safaricom and Equity Bank.

months.title: Month 1: Backend Mastery & API Architecture
tasks: Design relational database schemas using ERDs
Build a RESTful API with full CRUD functionality
projects: M-Pesa Integrated E-commerce Backend: An API that handles product management and simulates payment callbacks.
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: Advanced Python & Environment Setup
Focus on decorators, generators, and context managers. Set up a professional workflow using Poetry or Pipenv.

### Week 2: Django Fundamentals
Deep dive into the Django ORM, Migrations, and Admin panel. Understand the MVT pattern.

### Week 3: Django REST Framework (DRF)
Transition to building APIs. Learn Serializers, ViewSets, and Permissions.

### Week 4: Databases & Deployment
Switch from SQLite to PostgreSQL. Deploy your first API to Render or Railway.app.

resources.name: Django for Beginners (Will Vincent)
resources.description: The gold standard for learning Django from scratch.

resources.name: Safaricom Daraja API Portal
resources.description: Essential for any Kenyan developer to understand M-Pesa integration.

months.title: Month 2: Modern Frontend with React
tasks: Convert static HTML designs into reusable React components
Manage global state without Redux using Context API
Consume Month 1's Python API using Axios
Implement responsive design using Tailwind CSS
projects: Personal Finance Tracker: A dashboard that visualizes spending habits, fetching data from your Python backend.
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: JavaScript Essentials
Focus on Promises, Async/Await, and Array Methods (map, filter, reduce).

### Week 2: React Basics
Learn JSX, Props, State, and the Component Lifecycle using Functional Components and Hooks (useState, useEffect).

### Week 3: Styling & UI
Master Tailwind CSS for rapid UI development. Build a multi-page layout using React Router.

### Week 4: Integration
Connect your React frontend to your Django API. Handle CORS issues and display dynamic data.

resources.name: Moringa School Open Events
resources.description: Attend local tech mixers and webinars hosted in Nairobi.

months.title: Month 3: Systems, DevOps & Job Hunting
tasks: Containerize a full-stack application using Docker Compose
Optimize LinkedIn profile for Kenyan recruiters
projects: Professional Portfolio: A production-ready site hosted on a custom .ke or .com domain showcasing all previous work.
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: DevOps Basics
Learn Docker basics. Create a Dockerfile for your Django app and a Docker Compose file for the DB and Frontend.

### Week 2: DSA for Interviews
Focus on Arrays, Linked Lists, Stacks, Queues, and Big O notation. Use Python for implementations.

### Week 3: System Design & Documentation
Learn about Load Balancers, Caching (Redis), and writing clear README files and API docs (Swagger/Redoc).

### Week 4: Kenyan Market Strategy
Apply to 5 jobs daily on LinkedIn and MyJobMag. Reach out to tech recruiters at companies like Little, Wasoko, and Sendy.

resources.name: MyJobMag Kenya
resources.description: Top job board for tech roles in Kenya.

resources.name: Full Stack Python
resources.description: Explains the entire stack from server to CSS.

359d388d-68af-49b6-ab05-d55d91d31827.additional_info: Focus heavily on networking within the Nairobi tech scene (Silicon Savannah). Join the 'Nairobi Gophers' or 'Python Kenya' user groups on Meetup.com or Telegram. In the Kenyan market, having a project that includes a mobile money (M-Pesa) integration is often the 'X-factor' that gets a Junior hired over others.

6459cb7c-f524-46a3-bbdd-aaa03bd2e369.summary: This 8-week intensive roadmap transitions you from basic HTML/CSS knowledge to a job-ready Junior Frontend Developer, specifically optimized for the Nairobi tech ecosystem. It focuses on JavaScript mastery and React.js, which are currently the most in-demand skills in Kenya's 'Silicon Savannah'.

months.title: Month 1: JavaScript Mastery & Modern Styling
tasks: Master CSS Layouts (Flexbox and Grid) for responsive design
Learn JavaScript basics: variables, data types, and functions
Understand the Document Object Model (DOM) to make pages interactive
Practice API fetching using the Fetch API
Set up a GitHub profile and learn basic Git commands
projects: Dynamic Weather App using a public API
Personal Expense Tracker (optimized for KES currency)
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: Advanced CSS & Responsive Design
Focus on making layouts that work on mobile devices, as mobile traffic is dominant in Kenya. Learn CSS Grid and Flexbox.

### Week 2: JS Fundamentals
Learn variables (let/const), loops, and conditional statements. Practice logic building through small coding challenges.

### Week 3: DOM & Events
Learn how to select HTML elements and change their content or style using JavaScript. Build a 'To-Do List' that saves to local storage.

### Week 4: ES6 & API Integration
Study arrow functions, destructuring, and template literals. Learn how to fetch data from an external API (like OpenWeatherMap) and display it on your site.

resources.name: NairobiJS Meetup Group
resources.description: Local community for JavaScript developers in Nairobi.

resources.name: MDN Web Docs
resources.description: The gold standard for web documentation.

months.title: Month 2: React.js & Professional Portfolio
tasks: Manage application state with useState and useEffect
Integrate Tailwind CSS for rapid UI development
Deploy a professional portfolio to a live URL
projects: Real Estate Listing Site for Nairobi Neighborhoods
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 5: Introduction to React
Learn the component-based architecture. Understand JSX and how to pass data via Props.

### Week 6: State & Hooks
Deep dive into useState and useEffect. Build a functional application that reacts to user input in real-time.

### Week 7: Tailwind CSS & Routing
Learn Tailwind CSS for styling. Use React Router to create multi-page applications (Home, About, Contact).

### Week 8: Deployment & Job Prep
Finalize your portfolio. Host your projects on Vercel. Optimize your LinkedIn profile for the Nairobi market (mentioning proximity to tech hubs like Westlands and Ngong Road).

resources.name: Moringa School Blog
resources.description: Insights into the Kenyan tech job market.

resources.name: iHub Nairobi
resources.description: Innovation hub for networking and co-working spaces.

6459cb7c-f524-46a3-bbdd-aaa03bd2e369.additional_info: To succeed in Nairobi's market: 1. Network at iHub or Gearbox. 2. Tailor your CV for local recruiters like Shortlist or BrighterMonday. 3. Ensure your portfolio projects are mobile-responsive, as many local clients prioritize mobile-first experiences. 4. Join the 'KOT' (Kenyans on Twitter) tech community to find 'build-in-public' opportunities.

da125742-5ff6-446d-ac57-44159fe62f20.summary: A fast-paced, 8-week intensive roadmap designed to transition a beginner with basic Python knowledge into a Junior Python Developer, specifically tailored for the Nairobi tech ecosystem which favors web backend development and fintech integrations.

months.title: Month 1: Strengthening Fundamentals & Database Design
tasks: Master Python classes, inheritance, and dunder methods.
Learn to use Git for version control (branching, merging, pull requests).
Practice writing complex SQL queries and understanding normalization.
Learn to use 'pip' and 'venv' or 'poetry' for dependency management.
projects: Inventory Management System (CLI-based with SQL backend)
Personal Expense Tracker using Python and SQLite
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 1: Advanced Python Basics
Focus on OOP. Understand how to structure code into classes. Read about 'The Pythonic Way' (PEP 8).

### Week 2: Version Control & Environment
Set up a GitHub profile. Learn the command line. Every piece of code you write must now be pushed to a repository.

### Week 3: Databases (SQL)
Nairobi's corporate and startup world runs on data. Master PostgreSQL. Understand tables, relationships (1-to-many, many-to-many), and joins.

### Week 4: Introduction to Web Basics
Learn how the internet works (HTTP/HTTPS, Request/Response cycle). Start with a simple Flask 'Hello World'.

resources.name: Python Nairobi Community
resources.description: Local community for Python developers in Kenya. Great for networking and monthly meetups.

resources.name: Real Python
resources.description: High-quality tutorials for deep-diving into OOP and advanced concepts.

resources.name: Full Stack Python
resources.description: Explains why you use certain tools (databases, web servers) in the Python ecosystem.

months.title: Month 2: Web Frameworks, APIs & Job Readiness
tasks: Build a full-featured web application using Django.
Develop a RESTful API and document it using Swagger/Postman.
Integrate a local payment gateway (M-Pesa) into a project.
Write unit tests for your logic using 'pytest'.
Deploy a live project and optimize your LinkedIn/CV for the Nairobi market.
projects: Nairobi Housing Rental API using Django REST Framework
months.detailed_guide:
### Week 5: Deep Dive into Django
Learn the MVT (Model-View-Template) architecture. Build a blog or a simple e-commerce store.

### Week 6: REST APIs & DRF
Most Nairobi startups need API developers for mobile apps. Master Serializers, ViewSets, and Authentication in Django REST Framework.

### Week 7: Local Integrations & Testing
In Kenya, Fintech is king. Learn to integrate the Safaricom Daraja API. Write tests to ensure your payment logic doesn't fail.

### Week 8: Portfolio & Networking
Clean up your GitHub. Host your best project on Render or a VPS. Attend a tech event at iHub or Gearbox in Nairobi to network.

resources.name: Safaricom Daraja Portal
resources.description: Essential for learning how to integrate M-Pesa payments, a highly sought-after skill in Kenya.

resources.name: Django for Beginners (William Vincent)
resources.description: The best resource for getting a Django project up and running quickly.

resources.name: Moringa School Open Classroom
resources.description: Occasional free workshops and a great place to meet other learners in Nairobi.

da125742-5ff6-446d-ac57-44159fe62f20.additional_info: Focus heavily on the 'M-Pesa Integration' project; it is a major differentiator in the Nairobi job market. Ensure your LinkedIn profile mentions 'Python (Django)' and 'Backend Development'. Visit tech hubs like iHub (Kilimani) or Jenga Health to meet other developers. Networking in the Nairobi 'Silicon Savannah' is often more effective than cold-applying for jobs.

9cf80031-73df-4d28-ad89-5f5389296b70.summary: A comprehensive 6-month career transition roadmap designed to take a beginner with Python/JS knowledge to a job-ready AI Engineer status in Kenya. This path emphasizes data science fundamentals, deep learning, Generative AI, and deployment, leveraging local communities like AI Kenya and Zindi.

months.title: Data Science Foundations & Mathematics
tasks: Understand matrix operations and derivatives for backpropagation
Perform Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) on local datasets
projects: Analysis of Nairobi Housing Prices: A data visualization project using scraped or public real estate data.
months.detailed_guide:
### Weekly Breakdown
**Week 1:** Linear Algebra & Calculus for ML. Focus on matrices, vectors, and partial derivatives.
**Week 2:** Advanced Python for AI. Decorators, generators, and OOP principles.
**Week 3:** NumPy and Pandas. Efficient data processing and cleaning techniques.
**Week 4:** Data Visualization. Use Seaborn to find correlations in datasets.

resources.name: Khan Academy: Linear Algebra
resources.description: Foundational math for understanding how AI models process data.

resources.name: Zindi Africa
resources.description: The leading data science competition platform in Africa to find local datasets.

months.title: Classical Machine Learning
projects: Fintech Credit Scoring Model: Predict loan default probability using a synthetic Kenyan micro-lending dataset.
months.detailed_guide:
### Weekly Breakdown
**Week 1:** Regression models (Linear, Polynomial, Ridge/Lasso).
**Week 2:** Classification (Logistic Regression, SVMs, Decision Trees).
**Week 3:** Ensemble Methods (Random Forest, XGBoost, LightGBM).
**Week 4:** Dimensionality Reduction (PCA) and Clustering (K-Means).

resources.name: Machine Learning by Andrew Ng (Coursera)
resources.description: The gold standard for learning ML fundamentals.

resources.name: AI Kenya Meetups
resources.description: Join local meetups to see how ML is applied in the Kenyan corporate sector.

months.title: Deep Learning & Computer Vision
tasks: Build a multi-layer perceptron from scratch in Python
Train a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for image classification
Use pre-trained models like ResNet or VGG
projects: Crop Disease Classifier: An AI tool that identifies diseases in maize or cassava leaves from images.
months.detailed_guide:
### Weekly Breakdown
**Week 1:** Introduction to PyTorch Tensors and Autograd.
**Week 2:** Building Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs).
**Week 3:** Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for vision.
**Week 4:** Transfer Learning and fine-tuning models from HuggingFace/Torchvision.

resources.name: DeepLearning.AI
resources.description: Deep dive into neural networks and their architectures.

months.title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) & LLMs
tasks: Fine-tune a BERT model for sentiment analysis
Work with OpenAI API and LangChain
projects: Swahili Sentiment Analyzer: A tool to analyze public sentiment on Kenyan social media (Twitter/X).
months.detailed_guide:
### Weekly Breakdown
**Week 1:** Text preprocessing and Word Embeddings (Word2Vec, GloVe).
**Week 2:** Sequence models (RNNs, LSTMs) and the Transformer architecture.
**Week 3:** HuggingFace Ecosystem (Datasets, Transformers, Hub).
**Week 4:** Introduction to Large Language Models (LLMs) and RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation).

resources.name: Lanfrica
resources.description: A resource for African language datasets and research.

months.title: AI Engineering & MLOps
tasks: Wrap a model in a REST API using FastAPI
Set up a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing
projects: Production-Ready AI API: Deploy your Crop Disease Classifier as a scalable web service on AWS or Azure.
months.detailed_guide:
### Weekly Breakdown
**Week 1:** Backend development for AI with FastAPI.
**Week 2:** Dockerizing ML environments for reproducibility.
**Week 3:** Model serving (BentoML or Ray Serve) and monitoring.
**Week 4:** Cloud deployment basics (AWS SageMaker or Google Vertex AI).

resources.name: Made With ML
resources.description: Learn how to combine ML with software engineering best practices.

resources.name: Microsoft ADC Kenya
resources.description: Follow their events for insights into cloud engineering in the local market.

months.title: Portfolio & Career Launch
tasks: Write 2-3 technical blog posts on Medium or Dev.to
Apply for AI/ML roles in Nairobi-based tech hubs
projects: Capstone: RAG-based Chatbot for Kenyan Law: A chatbot that answers legal questions based on the Kenyan Constitution.
months.detailed_guide:
### Weekly Breakdown
**Week 1:** Finalizing the Capstone project and documentation.
**Week 2:** Optimizing LinkedIn and GitHub profiles. Focus on keywords like 'PyTorch', 'FastAPI', and 'LLMs'.
**Week 3:** Mock Interviews (LeetCode for Python and ML Theory).
**Week 4:** Networking and Job Applications. Reach out to local startups (e.g., in Safaricom's ecosystem or M-KOPA).

resources.name: DeepLearning.AI Nairobi
resources.description: Local chapter for networking with other AI practitioners in Kenya.

resources.name: ALX Africa
resources.description: Check for their AI Career programs specifically for African talent.

9cf80031-73df-4d28-ad89-5f5389296b70.additional_info: Focus on the 'Zindi' platform as it is highly regarded by Kenyan employers for validating practical skills. Networking at iHub or Gearbox in Nairobi can provide 'hidden' job opportunities. Given your JS background, don't ignore TensorFlow.js for in-browser AI, which is a niche but growing skill in the local web development market.
